markdown:
**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 7 2.0 Expand beyond the populous ancestries found in the _Core Rulebook_. The ancestry entry format is described [here](/Rules.aspx?ID=119).
  • **[Catfolk](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=17)**, or amurruns, are humanoid felines who believe they were created to protect the wilderness from great danger.
  • **[Kobolds](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=18)** are small reptiles connected to dragons and fond of traps.
  • **[Orcs](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=19)** are warlike and honest people who respect strength, toughness, and survival above all.
  • **[Ratfolk](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=20)** , or ysoki, pack into tight spaces and are markedly industrious and fastidious.
  • **[Tengus](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=21)** are corvid-like humanoids with an affinity for blades and the rumored mystical ability to absorb bad luck.
name: Ancestries
search_markdown:
<additional-info>
<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 7 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

Chapter 1: Ancestries & Backgrounds
</additional-info>
text: Ancestries Source Advanced Player's Guide pg. 7 2.0 Expand beyond the populous ancestries found in the Core Rulebook . The ancestry entry format is described here. Catfolk , or amurruns, are humanoid felines who believe they were created to protect the wilderness from great danger. Kobolds are small reptiles connected to dragons and fond of traps. Orcs are warlike and honest people who respect strength, toughness, and survival above all. Ratfolk , or ysoki, pack into tight spaces and are markedly industrious and fastidious. Tengus are corvid-like humanoids with an affinity for blades and the rumored mystical ability to absorb bad luck.
